Package cosc201.lec09

Class ArrayHeap<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
cosc201.lec09.ArrayHeap<T>
public class ArrayHeap<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
An array based max-heap implementation (for illustrative purposes only). First implementation, 2011, modifications through 2023.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public T get()
      Peek at the largest element of the heap (don't make any changes).
      Returns:
      The largest element of the heap.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Determine if the heap contains any elements
      Returns:
      true if the heap contains no elements

    • size

      public int size()
      Return the size of the heap
      Returns:
      the size of the heap

    • add

      public void add(T element)
      Add an element to the heap. The element is initially added in the first 'free' location (at position 'size'), after expanding capacity if needed. Then that element is allowed to float up the branch from it to the root of the heap whenever there's a violation of the condition that a parent node is meant to be greater than a child node.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to be added.

    • remove

      public T remove()
      Remove the largest element from the heap. That element is at position 0. To remove it, replace it with the element in the last occupied position (at position 'size - 1'). Then let that element sink to fix any heap violations -- to do this it needs to be exchanged with the larger of its children if either child is larger than it.
      Returns:
      The largest element of the heap.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
